p:
Phytochemical methods are used as a tool to study the different secondary metabolites present in plants that may be responsible for their medicinal properties.
15 The oil extract and powdered leaf of L. camara were subjected to phytochemical screening to identify the presence of active compounds such as alkaloids, tannins, saponins, flavonoids, triterpenoids, steroids, glycosides, and phenols. The presence of bioactive compounds was determined using standard methods.
